text: For instance, in Canada we use galvanised nails in place of screws. We just bend them over and clamp firmly by using a hammer each side. Over here I've always used brass screws, which are more expensive. The first job is to make your moulds. In Fig. nailed and glued together strongly, it may be marked and cut to shape later. for instance,in Canedor we use galranisld nails in glae of screws, We Just bend them oxer onsc/amp always. ustd tres scras which are more expensire.TheScf Job is to mohe yeur meulds, In Sig.1ib guotas 3/yin.Sivreply is nailes ans giues together strongly it mcy be marked ond cut toshape later
name: Peter Aspiotis
